Sugammadex

Sugammadex Reversal agent for neuromuscular blockers, superior to anticholinesterases because it does not have a ceiling effect . A modified γ-cyclodextrin (therefore it is 8 glucose molecules in a ring structure). C 72 H 104 O 48 S 8 Na 8 ; MW=2178Da).

[sketch of 8 rings, 8 sulphurs on 8 negatively charged hydrophilic side chains, hydrophobic cavity]

Encapsulates rocuronium (MW=610Da) and vecuronium, binds them avidly with:

- Van der Waals forces

- Hydrophobic attraction

- Electrostatic attraction

…and so rapidly decreases the concentration of free rocuronium in blood, creating a large gradient for the diffusion of rocuronium away from the NMJ. The complex is water soluble and renally excreted.

May also encapsulate (with much less affinity):

Verapamil

Oestrogens (possibly contraceptive hormones)

Cortisol

Atropine Large doses cause hypotension, QT prolongation.
